arts.ttl: Why wasting chances wasn't Michael Carrick's biggest Middlesbrough frustration at Watford
arts.sum: A frustrated Michael Carrick rued Middlesbrough's late collapse at Watford as he admitted his side didn't help themselves as they lost 2-1 despite leading with 15 minutes remaining. Asked if he was sat wondering how his side hadn't won that game, Carrick said: "I know why, some of the reasons why we ended up losing it.

arts.ttl: 'They stuck together after Wednesday' - Cleverley on his Watford players
arts.sum: The Hornets boss was full of praise for his side as they beat Middlesbrough 2-1 three days after a huge disappointment at Preston.

arts.ttl: Watford 2 Middlesbrough 1 - how the game unfolded
arts.sum: A minute-by-minute report from Vicarage Road as Watford come back from a goal down to beat Middlesbrough.

arts.ttl: Watford substitutes star in comeback win over Middlesbrough
arts.sum: Edo Kayembe and Kwadwo Baah scored to overhaul George Edmundson’s opener.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough squander a commanding lead and lose at Watford after conceding two late goals
arts.sum: Early signs in the second half were much of the same as Boro quickly settled into possession dominance, with Watford looking to counter. Boro looked comfortable as Watford struggled for a breakthrough before Tom Cleverley's subs inspired a fightback from the home side.

arts.ttl: Anderlecht hold talks with former Watford head coach after Mark van Bommel turned the side down
arts.sum: HLN are reporting that Mark van Bommel has turned down the opportunity to return to management in Belgium with Anderlecht. The man who won the double for Antwerp just a…

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough need to do another first to win Watford test after overcoming West Brom
arts.sum: Tom Cleverley's side had an excellent start to the season but have lost three of their last five games coming into this one - including Wednesday evening's 3-0 defeat at Preston North End. The bad news for Boro, though, all three of those defeats were away from home. They're a good team and we know we're in for a tough game.

arts.ttl: Jonathan Woodgate credit as Middlesbrough have 'the feel' for defensive instructions
arts.sum: Michael Carrick offered credit to Jonathan Woodgate as he described the importance of his Middlesbrough players feeling the reward for their defensive work. "You look at Manu, for example, and the recent impact he’s had, it’s not necessarily the goals but he’s playing his role as everyone else is and we’re stronger for that.

arts.ttl: 'Mid-table mindset' - Tom Cleverley's Watford blast after Preston loss ahead of Middlesbrough - Teesside Live
arts.sum: Tom Cleverley accused his Watford players of having a 'mid-table mindset' as he demanded a reaction against Middlesbrough following the midweek defeat to Preston North End. That doesn't make Michael Carrick's former Manchester United team-mate feel much better though, as he made clear his expectations of his side in Saturday's game.

arts.ttl: Emmanuel Latte Lath Middlesbrough goals drought claim with Michael Carrick still encouraged
arts.sum: More importantly for Carrick though, the striker still made vital contributions in both games - with the Boro boss stressing the goals will come. Michael Carrick is convinced that the goals will come for Emmanuel Latte Lath, and has stressed the importance that the striker just keeps doing what he's doing - with his influence for Middlesbrough stretching beyond just his goals.
